question:
Which of the following are the environmental effects of Fly Ash?
1. Fly Ash  can pollute air and water considerably if it is not captured and disposed off properly
2. It causes respiratory problems.
3. Fly ash settles on leaves and crops in fields in areas near to thermal power plants and lowers the plant yield.
Select the correct option from the codes given below:
explanation: Fly Ash  can pollute air and water considerably if it is not captured and disposed off properly. It causes respiratory problems. Fly ash settles on leaves and crops in fields in areas near to thermal power plants and lowers the plant yield.
